headline: US no longer accuses Venezuela's Nicolas Maduro of leading the 'Cartel de los Soles'
subhead: The indictment against the former Venezuelan president, presented by US authorities on Monday, no longer includes the accusation from five years ago, which had until recently been claimed by the Trump administration.

headline: Trump weighs 'range of options' for acquiring Greenland, including military ones
subhead: Donald Trump is looking at ideas for acquiring the Danish territory and using the US military is 'always an option,' the White House said on Tuesday. Earlier, Greenland and Denmark called for a meeting with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio after Trump's renewed claims.

headline: Iran risks losing a key economic and military ally in Venezuela
subhead: Tehran and Caracas have maintained close ties with each other, notably to circumvent the sanctions against both countries. Iran, which has also come under threat from Washington, has projected a facade of optimism.

headline: Trump says Venezuela is 'turning over' up to 50 million barrels of oil to US
subhead: The US president, in a post on Truth Social on Tuesday, said 'that money will be controlled by me' and that he will 'ensure it is used to benefit the people of Venezuela and the United States.'

headline: Roberto Saviano, writer: 'Venezuela is not a narco-state, but a state that uses drugs as an instrument for the survival of those in power'
subhead: Western democracies have allowed the regime to survive, enabling it to strengthen itself by becoming increasingly criminalized. Today, the country acts as a hub state, exhibiting advanced forms of narco-structuring, writes the author of 'Gomorrah.'

EU offers extra funds to quell farmer anger over Mercosur trade deal
'If tomorrow, the US decides to seize Greenland, neither Denmark nor the EU has the means to stop it'
subhead: Donald Trump's military operation in Venezuela should show Europeans that the US is a predator for Europe, just like Russia and China, argues former United Nations under-secretary-general Jean-Marie Guéhenno.

headline: Maduro, the failed heir to Hugo Chavez's Bolivarian Revolution
subhead: The Venezuelan president, recently abducted by the US, was chosen by Hugo Chavez as his successor and narrowly elected in 2013. Over 13 years in power, he has eliminated political opposition, tightened control over state institutions and overseen a 70% collapse in GDP as a quarter of Venezuelans fled the country.

headline: Maduro capture marks new blow to dying international order
subhead: Venezuela's allies condemned an 'illegal act of aggression' while countries aligned with the US urged restraint but sought to avoid directly criticizing Donald Trump.

headline: Greenland is and must remain European
The return of the US's predatory imperialism
'Trump and Putin share a common enemy, liberal Europe, but they have two divergent strategic projects'
